acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours ErC50=0.0021mg/L of the algae (Green Algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >2,000mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat inhalation study reported the LC50 value of >1.97mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no evidence of treatment-related incidence of tumor formation observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=3.21(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 117.5-119degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2001))).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro reverse mutation tests, in vitro chromosome aberration tests, and mouse in vivo micronucleus tests  (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995, 2004)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is stable to heat (deterioration occurs at about 300degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2001))

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: No evidence of fetal effects was seen in teratogenicity studies performed in rats and rabbits. In rat 2-generation reproduction studies, the gestational period and the number of newborn/live born-pups were slightly reduced, and there were decreases in viability index (F2) and female genital tubercle to vaginal opening distance (F1), and the occurrence of hypospadia (F2) at doses inducing a reduction in parental body weight gains.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being sulfonyls, containing chemical groups with self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of conjunctival effects with a mean score of <=1.0, which disappeared by 48 hours, observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1955)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests employing the Maximization method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1997)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (gastrointestinal tract)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including vacuolization of ciliated epithelial cells in the jejunum (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In single dose oral toxicity studies in animals, there were no signs or symptoms of toxicity reported other than a reduction in body weight or body weight gain at 5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).
